TopicTitle: 2 issues---- Smoothly landed back on Kerbal, but cannot end fligt / in space cannot set course

Articles.Content:
Hey guys,

need help one more time, since the game isn't giving me feedback in career mode.

First problem : In the space map I'm unable to set a course... Usually when you click the apothesis icon you get the "course-meter" (you know what I mean ) where you can click and drag to set a course for a orbit or something else... But I'm not allowed to do that in the career mode, nothing happens when I click the icon... Most likely I'm missing something... What is mandatory for being allowed to do that ?

Second, more bad at the moment :

I just came back from a nice orbital flight... completed two small missions in orbit, and then landed back on kerbal very smoothly. Only capsule left, no damage, kerbal alive... But now I cannot end the flight, i will bite my ass when I loose this progress.... What I tried : I cannot click the "recover button" or the "spacecenter" button above the alt-meter... Everytime I do, I just get the "no target" message. Also, when I hit ESC, I cannot "end flight" (that option isn't even in the list) and I cannot go back to space center, I can only revert, which would be really unfair.

Maybe related :

I landed very far away from my base, probably on the other side of the planet (in a big desert)... And I haven't actived the action (order) that allows recovery from far away... Is that the problem ? Yet still I should be able to end the flight and loose the kerbal itself.

Anyone know what is wrong ?
